description:
'''John Weldon''' "'''J. J.'''" '''Cale''' (December 5, 1938 â€“ July 26, 2013) was an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter. Though he avoided the limelight, his influence as a musical artist has been acknowledged by figures such as  [[Neil Young]], [[Mark Knopfler]], [[Waylon Jennings]], and [[Eric Clapton]], who described him as one of the most important artists in rock history. He is one of the originators of the [[Tulsa sound]], a loose genre drawing on [[blues]], [[rockabilly]], [[Country music|country]], and [[jazz]].

In 2008, Cale and Clapton received a [[Grammy Award]] for their album ''[[The Road to Escondido]]''.
